verses.text: Make a joyful noise unto God, all ye lands:
Sing forth the honour of his name: Make his praise glorious.
Say unto God, How terrible \add art thou in\add* thy works! Through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies submit themselves unto thee.
All the earth shall worship thee, And shall sing unto thee; they shall sing \add to\add* thy name. Selah.
Come and see the works of God: \add He is\add* terrible \add in his\add* doing toward the children of men.
He turned the sea into dry \add land:\add* They went through the flood on foot: There did we rejoice in him.
He ruleth by his power for ever; His eyes behold the nations: Let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.
O bless our God, ye people, And make the voice of his praise to be heard:
Which holdeth our soul in life, And suffereth not our feet to be moved.
For thou, O God, hast proved us: Thou hast tried us, as silver is tried.
Thou broughtest us into the net; Thou laidst affliction upon our loins.
Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads; We went through fire and through water: But thou broughtest us out into a wealthy \add place\add*.
I will go \add into\add* thy house with burnt offerings: I will pay thee my vows,
Which my lips have uttered, And my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.
I will offer unto thee burnt sacrifices of fatlings, With the incense of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah.
Come \add and\add* hear, all ye that fear God, And I will declare what he hath done for my soul.
I cried unto him \add with\add* my mouth, And \add he was\add* extolled with my tongue.
If I regard iniquity in my heart, The Lord will not hear \add me:\add*
\add But\add* verily God hath heard \add me;\add* He hath attended to the voice of my prayer.
Blessed \add be\add* God, which hath not turned away my prayer, Nor his mercy from me.
